website_summaries.verdict: Growing crystals with this affordable kit can be both fun and disappointing, but it's definitely worth considering for children interested in geology.
pros: A long-time favorite for aspiring scientists
Kit provides everything needed to grow colorful crystals
Includes display cases for showing off grown crystals
cons: Instructions must be followed closely, or results will be marginal
Supervision may be needed, as the kit contains chemicals

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but not if you follow the directions!
customer_reviews.text: If you want the crystals that look like the cover, do not follow the directions! When you "seed" the crystal stuff to start them growing, the directions tell you to spread the stuff evenly across the little tub, but if you do this you end up with a film of little crystals all across the bottom and sides of the container and not the big dramatic crystals depicted on the box. Concentrate the "seed" stuff into a small pile in the center of the growing tub and you get a dramatic, spiky, crystal cluster that looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Garry Gaudin

customer_reviews.title: Don't wait to open the box like I did
customer_reviews.text: I just opened the box to read the directions before I did this with my kids. Chemical powder mixes all expired 6 months ago. Seeds expired 7 months ago. I bought this 1 month ago and missed my return time by 3 days. Don't wait to open the box like I did!
customer_reviews.author: sharon anderson

customer_reviews.title: Complete flop!
customer_reviews.text: The crystal compond had a date of November 2016 not sure if this is a packaged on date or expiration date but either way only formed crystals around the rim.... after 8 days at 70°f not a single crystal formed in the bottom
customer_reviews.author: bebe

customer_reviews.title: Interesting and fun
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a project for my son and I to do together, since I thought it would be interesting to him and be a learning experience while being fun at the same time. He was super interested in it and loved the whole process. But there is quite a bit of down time/waiting in between the steps so there were a lot of breaks where we had to find something else to do to kill time while we waited. Overall, it was a pretty simple and straightforward process and experiment, with easy to follow directions. But the crystals never did end up growing quite as well as they were supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Rarely write reviews but had to on this one. Got it for our grandson. Not one of the crystals grew to anything remotely shown on the cover of the package. Most were duds. very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Allyala Nandakumar

customer_reviews.title: educational and fun for kids and grown ups
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Your child will definitely will need help and supervision. My granddaughter was very excited as she watch the crystals forming for a period of seven days. There is enough material to repeat the experiment a few more times at a later time after the first and second set. She placed the crystals in their individual display clear boxes once they were washed. Very educational. There were lots of questions and answers going back and forth about the crystals. We did online research which she enjoyed. She is only 5 yrs old and was able to follow the instructions. A great bonding and fun educational moment.
customer_reviews.author: Ita

customer_reviews.title: Great activity to do with parents
customer_reviews.text: Santa brought this to advanced 6 and 8 year olds. Their father a professor facilitated the experiment with each. The 8 year old was extremely interested the 6 year old was more interested in keeping up with the older. The results take a week as published. Very satisfied with those. The crystals are extremely fragile but impressive. The results are approximately a 2”X2” crystal in a plastic container.
customer_reviews.author: L. House

customer_reviews.title: very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Comes in an attractive box. But materials inside are not very clearly marked, and the instructions are not as helpful as they could be. We've only tried once but it was a complete dud: looked like something happening at first, and then nothing. Could be we did it wrong: but that might be the fault of the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Krupat

customer_reviews.title: Great for little science minds
customer_reviews.text: While our crystals did not grow as large as the ones on the box I believe it is because we only waited a week. My boys are 5 and 7 years old and we’re able to do most steps independently but the color STAINS everything it touches, so be careful. The reason for only 4 stars is because I feel the instructions could have been a little more clear. Before growth began I questioned if we missed a step. However if you watch a YouTube video of someone else it’s super easy (to bad I watched the video after the fact)
customer_reviews.author: brandon653

customer_reviews.title: Great gift product!
customer_reviews.text: Another toy thats more for parent (mommy me!) than kids. I had alot of fun preparing everything including reading through pretty lengthy instruction. My son, who’s four, enjoyed my instruction, which was a condensed version after i read the entire thing. He really likes this especially the daily monitoring and see how the crystal grow each day. He took daily pictures for the progres. For the darker colored crystals that you cant see the crystal itself, we lit a flashlight underneath the container. That kinda gave a different way of looking at it. Overall we both enjoyed it and as a parent, this would be the gift i rather receive than toys, other than lego of course.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Categorically incorrect questions.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon’s categories were ‘thickness’ and ‘warmth’. I have no idea what those have to do with this science kit. So if the review is anything but 5 stars, it’s because I have the ‘thickness’ category a 1 star, and the rocks themselves aren’t really warm, so that gets a 1 star. If there were relevant questions, like ‘was this science kit an awesome project to do with your kids while you’re stuck at home during Covid-19’.... I’d quickly give that a 5 star. This kit was fun, the instructions were easy to follow (even for me, a person who finds typos and errors in every instructions sheet I read). It’s super and duper, and also is super.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Best varied crystal growing kit
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 6 year old niece. She was so excited to get it! The age range on the box is for older kids but she did great with this with help from her parents and really enjoyed watching her crystals grow. This seemed like the best quality kit and with the most variety of crystals out there, also for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ward

customer_reviews.title: some came out nice ( two) others extremely fragile
customer_reviews.text: a huge mess and pain even with an adult and al the precautions followed, still stained everything they touched, some came out nice ( two) others extremely fragile. the display containers do not fit properly waste of money and time
customer_reviews.author: not picky

customer_reviews.title: My son an I were so excited but quality of components was lacking.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of bummed. The plastic cups had hairline cracks on the seams/corners so it is hard to see them. All of the fluid leaked out all over the table and the whole product got wasted. See photo of dent and example of crack. I had to put the spoon through it just to get it to show up on camera.
customer_reviews.author: Nekogeisha

customer_reviews.title: Review - beginning and end
customer_reviews.text: Day 1 - So far, excellent. We prepared the medium blue crystals batch yesterday. Less than 24 hours later, they are already 1" long. We followed the instructions carefully and placed the containers on top of the fridge. My 7-year-old got really excited to see how they are growing. As there are several negative reviews, I've decided to follow this step by step and give updates. Day 4 - the blue crystal was sticking out if the surface and we drained both batches. The purple one was slightly disappointing in shape, yet we enjoyed seeing his different they were. I'm listing a pic of what remains after my son handled and played with them.
customer_reviews.author: Alice B.

customer_reviews.title: Too Hazardous
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter who loves rocks and crystals. I fully understand that it is a science experiment and therefore it will involve chemicals. But I didn't realize that she would not even be able to touch the crystals at the end without wearing gloves. That kind of ruins the whole thing. Not to mention I don't really want to have something hazardous hanging around the house. Unfortunately, this project will probably get tossed once we look at the crystals.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: These worked out so much better than I had anticipated. The crystals REALLY grew... we let them grow for about 10 days and each crystal did so well. Our 5 year old LOVED looking at them first thing in the morning and then again after school each day to see progress. I highly recommend... very fun and successful project!
customer_reviews.author: C M

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: We bought these as a Christmas present for my son. He absolutely loves them. They take a while to grow but that's expected. The instructions were easy to follow along with and he enjoys looking at them growing.
customer_reviews.author: alexa

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely loved it! I didn't have much hope for it ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved it! I didn't have much hope for it but my little brother really wanted to try it as a science project. We did it together I messed up the first one (light blue) but it still turned out great. I would recommend this for anyone who likes this kind of stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work as well as the pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions, but it didn't work as well as the pictures. Not nearly as well. I should mention for context that I'm a chemist by education and profession and totally understand how crystallization works. I followed the instructions closely, but even after an extra day of waiting, only a few small crystals formed. I think the instructions are a little off. If I were to do this again, I would cut down on the water a bit and make a more concentrated solution.
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience, messy and results not as expected
customer_reviews.text: It's very messy. And no matter how hard we tried thr crystals won't look nice like the picture it was just a giant mess. We usually do experiments for kids but this is waste of time and money could have done much better without this set at a fraction of price. Only one of the crystals kinds formsed like the picture after 2 days or so still a lot of gue and liquid left at the bottom of the container
customer_reviews.author: NewMom

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be a great family project. Went to make first crystal and found out about a hour later the plastic didn't hold the water and leaked all over my counter.
customer_reviews.author: Kat C.

customer_reviews.title: Read instructions
customer_reviews.text: This was a difficult project.... only made one crystal out of the entire box. We read all the instructions numerous times and still only made one crystal
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Hall

customer_reviews.title: Fun little project
customer_reviews.text: OK so this was a fun little project to do with my nine-year-old daughter. It was easy to do. However not all of the crystals grow exactly alike. Out of the eight crystals only one grew really large. The others were smaller. But my daughter did like that they were all unique. But if you’re looking for every crystal to grow large like the ones presented on the box you may be getting your hopes up.
customer_reviews.author: Harriet helms

customer_reviews.title: I read through the instructions first and they were very easy to follow and straight forward
customer_reviews.text: The kit arrived yesterday and my son wanted to start the crystals right away. I read through the instructions first and they were very easy to follow and straight forward. Less than 24 hours later there a very visible crystals growing in our containers. We are excited to see the final outcome! Great experiment for kids who love crystals.
customer_reviews.author: Han L Doan

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun ! Great experience for kids ! Very creative entertainment!  Great gift would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Bought for young teen girl around 12, she really enjoyed it a lot, she grew the crystals when she had a friend over for few days, it was really fun for them watch their creation grow, I thought it was a great gift ! I enjoy watching kids do creative stuff and seeing their expressions on faces when it comes together as in WOW IT REALLY WORKS look what we grew Crystals ! Loads of fun and great experience, entertaining too !
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are overwhelming
customer_reviews.text: First off the instructions are beyond over doing but to the point they are ridiculously confusing at times. It was fun to have my 8 year old so involved in a little project we did together. I know she enjoyed yet again though she became annoyed as much as I did with the confusing instructions at times. Also it took almost 2 months for our crystals to grow, not days like the instructions stated. Yes we followed directions but they are terrible. We've done many crystal growing kits over the years without any issues & only this brand had an insane amount of directions or issues with the time frame for them to grow.
customer_reviews.author: DaddyDo

customer_reviews.title: Mesmerizing!
customer_reviews.text: This was "science" class for our now home schooled 3rd grader. The instructions are clear and were easy for her to follow with just me supervising. The crystal grew as described and was pretty cool. She chose to do the blue, largest crystal first and it did not disappoint. It is now displayed near a window while we work on picking out which one we will do next. pro tip: you can't move it during the growing period so we put it in a cabinet and used a flashlight to light it up while it grew - super cool.
customer_reviews.author: Miklisa

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking Rock Crystals... ON the Box!
customer_reviews.text: I proudly displayed this box in my glass cabinet because I know I'm an utter failure at any science experiments. I mean the box looks real nice and will not melt or get broken unlike real minerals. It's been over a year since I bought this and I read somewhere it'll expire in 6 months, oh well. At least I got it at a huge discount. I'll have to rebuy this kit when it goes on sale again.
customer_reviews.author: SN

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I know it says for 10+ years, but I couldn't wait! Birthday gift for my 4yr old Granddaughter. I do most of it anyway. I had these as a kid & loved watching them grow! I've given everyone of my Grandchildren & their friends these crystals to grow. We are on day 6 and all of them are growing huge. We check them a few times a day. I showed her how to put small flash light behind them to see all the crystals forming in mixture. She is SO excited to take them out tomorrow. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry Lee Boehl

customer_reviews.title: Takes 7+ days
customer_reviews.text: This is a 7 to 8 day project. Set up is complex. Kids 7/8+ Needs room temp or warmer. Day one set up Day two help it along Day two through seven wait while it's in 70° or above. Day 7/8 see true results. Good exercise 👍 kids really enjoyed it outside the 7 day wait... Lol
customer_reviews.author: R. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Fun set, great family project for the Christmas break!
customer_reviews.text: Very fun project! My kids enjoyed working on it, and checking the growing crystals each day. Three of the crystals were not very successful, which was a shame because my kids did two each, so that left some of them disappointed. There was a lot of "crystal climbing", and two of them dried out before nice crystals could form. The crystals with red seemed to be the most successful, and the ones with just blue or white failed or were very small. Over all we were pleased and maybe we will get another set and try again.
customer_reviews.author: B.W.

customer_reviews.title: instructions clear, results match
customer_reviews.text: My kid and I had a blast with this. We grew the crystals exactly as the instructions said, and the crystals grew EXACTLY as advertised. Pictured is the red/pink crystal we grew. It turned out great. We overwashed it a bit at the end and it began to melt, but that was our fault, not the product.
customer_reviews.author: Felix C

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, so I knew we had to follow the directions to a T. We watched videos to ensure we did everything properly. The blue crystal barely turned out. The red crystals didn't work out at all. And like other reviews, white was the only one that worked out. Very pricey product for very little satisfaction for my 5 year old. Disappointed. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Eh...just ok.
customer_reviews.text: I heard such great things about this set. My kids are really into science things. We wanted to like these , but we just didn’t. Too much work and the crystals weren’t super impressive. My husband did most of the work (because are kids are still young), and it seemed quite intensive. Our results definitely didn’t look like the box...at all. 3 stars though because it was fun to try and the kids did see some stuff grow.
customer_reviews.author: Kins

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't look like crystals..AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: Ok...its cool that any chemical reaction occured and ours began to grow in the first 15 hours. But absolutely nothing ever reached the height or width stated in the instructions or in the pictures on the box. Also, we read and reread the instructions...it calls for 200ml of water to dissolve the solution but only about 20ml are required to fill the lid?? Perhaps a misprint that led to our lack of growth. I wish we had more colored packets because we have extra white and would love to try again. Dont expect the depicted growth...but still interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Carly P

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kiddies
customer_reviews.text: Made these crystals with our 10 year old and 4 year old. Be sure to boil your water to reach to temperature. They had a fun time mixing the products and watching them everyday. Wear gloves when it’s time to rinse because it will be messy, line with paper towel or place developing crystals on a cookie sheet. The crystal will overflow.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie M.

customer_reviews.title: Great crystals and easy to do
customer_reviews.text: it was really easy to grow these crystals in the fact that you grow them and then can display them in the same container is fantastic. Are crystals were a big success and my children have them on display 2 years after we ordered our first box. The colors have diminished in the blue crystals we made but my children really enjoy looking at them and the different shapes they formed. One of them grew so large that it grew outside of the liquid and started expanding like a mushroom cloud, which my children thought was fantastic. I highly recommend this as an easy kit for children around age 8 and above to be able to do on their own.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions and enjoy the results
customer_reviews.text: I did this with a 7 year old. There needs to be a lot of adult supervision - basically the adult is doing most of the work. The plastic containers are on the flimsy side. However, it was a fun experiment to do and the ending result was pretty. When the crystal starts growing up the side of the container, be sure to put the paper circle around the top because it will spill out and make a mess of whatever it's sitting on. Other than that, we didn't have much of a mess at all.
customer_reviews.author: Moot Pt

customer_reviews.title: Very poor growing and disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This is terrible. I did this with my daughter think it was going to be a fun experiment for the week to grow crystals. followed every step to a tee! We grew nothing. We did get a little bit of crystal tracking. Package said that normal but no-way near what the box shows or explain. Wish i could upload the picture of my experiment. What a sad mess and disappointment to my child.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Rubino

customer_reviews.title: Instructions were less than helpful
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were not very clear.... My grandson and I were doing this together and it was a bit confusing. We did get a crystal to grow, but it also grew a crusty coating over the cover. No matter how hard we tried to keep it cleaned off, it just kept growing, I finally got tired of the mess and ended the project. As I said, we did grow a crystal but it might have grown larger without all the stuff crawling over the sides of the cover. More work than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: sr139

customer_reviews.title: Great for science project fun with the kids.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this. I understand no result will be the same and temperatures play a role. We had a warm day when we started but then the temp dropped a lot so I'm not sure if that effected our Crystal's. We made 4 small ones and 3 turned out super brittle like dried sugar. Our best one that looks like it's supposed to grew in smaller chunks. But I bought it for science experiment purposes and we still have more to make from the same box! If you're looking for a project for you and your kids, this is great. If you're looking for perfect Crystal's to decorate your room with, buy some already grown ones.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal S

customer_reviews.title: Cool Crystals!-fun and easy to make!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 7 year old and we just made one on the 7 of 2017 we had fun making a blue one and its already statrted crystelizing!great product but wait time is LONG" are crystel wont be don for 24 days or so...we only made one together so we can make the box last.you can mix colors to make diffurent crystals but once you open a color pallet you have to use it all! i fully reccomend this product its a gret way to seek patiance and have fun with vewing diffurent stages of your crystal its pretty cool!
customer_reviews.author: TiredEyeShark

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with kit, very difficult to use, Crystal's didnt grow, my daughter was very upset... Money down the drain, cant return cause it's been used...
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: No crystals, just a soft sludge
customer_reviews.text: The two (2) star rating is because though I followed instructions there was no crystal growth of any size, just some sludge at the bottom of the container, and I was left with a very disappointed six (6) year old grandson. I fully understand caveat emptor so the fault lies with me for believing the product description. My suggestion to the vendor is to do more quality assurance inspections and work with your suppliers to ensure that you are actually getting the ingredients ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Old Army Dog

customer_reviews.title: Results weren't that great.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the 6 that could have turned out, we only had one that looked good. I followed the instructions exactly. It looks like everyone else had good experiences with this but unfortunately we did not. My daughter loves the one that did turn out though. I've used kits like this in the past and had great results so I am confident it's not user error.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Neal

customer_reviews.title: Messy
customer_reviews.text: When these form crystals, they also form a big mess. It's like little elves come out at not and splash it colored sugar all around the container. Also, it takes days for the change to take place, so it's not for the impatient child. Still, one of my kids like them. Better have lower expectations. They don't end up look like the picture. We bought two boxes and did all the kits in each box and not one of them looked like the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: We loved it
customer_reviews.text: My 11-year-old son insisted I write this review, right after we finished displaying lovely crystals we grew together. We had fun together mixing dissolving watching them grow and talking about crystals and chemistry. It takes a little adult assistance, but not much. I think it makes a lovely gift for a science-minded child. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Auden

customer_reviews.title: We had the best time watching them grow day by day
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my boyfriend's birthday. We had the best time watching them grow day by day. We made 3 the first weekend and tried to make 4 more the next one. Well...he didn't make sure the water was boiling so the crystal powder didn't fully dissolve. He tried to boil more water and mix it in...then pour some out to make sure we didn't have too much water....didn't work. They didn't grow. The measurements need to be exact and directions followed. We will try again soon.
customer_reviews.author: itsme.rivera

customer_reviews.title: solar car----a piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: A STEM product given to grand daughter--as educational product it is a miserable failure--incomplete, erroneous instructions, frustrating for child to follow instructions and not work. Believe this sets a standard that Amazon suppliers are content to peddle junk---get their money and deliver junk. Buyer beware. Unless it is replaced I am no longer an Amazon customer. Even purchased a service warranty but no action. What are you gonna do about it? Above ratings cannot be used since there is nothing below zero. Should be a negative rating for a proper score. .
customer_reviews.author: larry wilson

customer_reviews.title: Fun with kids
customer_reviews.text: My son and I had such a great time doing this. We had a very successful outcome with all of the crystals. We actually made one large one, 2 medium ones and used the last of the stuff to make 4 small ones. We were very patient and let these sit way up in a cupboard, untouched for almost twice as long as suggested. I think this helped with our positive outcome. I would def recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: Growing diamonds?
customer_reviews.text: Told my 6 year old he could grow diamonds using this kit. He hasn't stopped trying. It's really sweet to see him trying but I'm admittedly getting tired of having tiny crystal shards all over the house. And I'm totally surprised at how fast they grow too. 8 to 12 hours and there's another crystal colony ready to display. Got a budding scientist in your household? Get this they'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: nancyben

customer_reviews.title: 4M Crystal Growing Experiment - So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: 4M Crystal Growing Experiment - So far so good! We've grown one so far to see how it would come out and it pretty much did what it states it would. We we careful to follow directions, like making sure the hot water was at the right temperature, drying it out and not moving it at all, etc. I would recommend this kit if you like some interactive projects to do with your kids! He(9yo) was so amazed at the outcome. Overall a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper 808

customer_reviews.title: Great project that gives for days
customer_reviews.text: Great project, says for 10+ but honestly I did this with my 5 year old and she loves looking at it each day and watching it grow. It didn't get as big as we wanted but I think because we are in TX it's too hot, did it needs a constant 68° for maximum growth.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne B.

customer_reviews.title: the crystals do not look anything like that. I found it interesting and enjoyed it
customer_reviews.text: The pictures on the front are hugely deceiving. The "display containers" are about as thin as new eco friendly water bottles and weigh about a gram. The will not protect it from anything except a sneeze... Maybe not even a sneeze. Also, the crystals do not look anything like that. I found it interesting and enjoyed it, but I feel like 90% of people who buy it are gonna be angry.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpaw

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy project for kids
customer_reviews.text: Great project for children. Most kids would need a parent to help with set up. Makes 7 different crystals. 1 large, 2 medium and 4 small. The crystals grow very fast and you'll see the crystals forming within a few hours. My 10 year old daughter loved making them.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Overall really cool
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun project for me and my kid's. I bought it for my 11 year old but both the 7 and 5 year old were very interested in this. Pros: All the kids loved it Learning how the chemicals worked together to make the crystals Relatively inexpensive The crystals began to grow soon after we mixed the solution. Even though it took 7 days to complete, the kids could see progress daily. Cons: The lids did not fit well and kept popping off so we are displaying the crystals without lids
customer_reviews.author: Danny Ace

customer_reviews.title: The plastic sticker which supposed to seal the box was torn off and it looked like someone messed with the items inside because they were ...
customer_reviews.text: The Crystal growing product box depicted on the photo was open inside the regular shipment box. The plastic sticker which supposed to seal the box was torn off and it looked like someone messed with the items inside because they were just shuvved and disformed (the plastic bowls). I am not positive that all which supposed to be there is actually there.
customer_reviews.author: Ludmila Podwell

customer_reviews.title: Expired
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this as a present for Christmas and she followed the directions clearly but it turns out that the products were expired we were very disappointed because instead of the "crystals" grew on the edge of the container instead of upwards.
customer_reviews.author: joAnn

customer_reviews.title: It was neat
customer_reviews.text: My kids enjoyed seeing the growth in their crystals. You have to read and follow the instructions carefully. We used bottle water because we are on a well with a water softener. The ring templates did not stop the crystal climbing. Once it climbed over the edge, it would pull the liquid out of the container. I had wax paper underneath so it didn't stain my counter. We did have. Let down when the display base and covers didn't fit together at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Daykin

customer_reviews.title: One packet worked, and it takes 4-7 days for growth...
customer_reviews.text: At least one out of three packets worked... You get three packets of mix and this can be divided among different size containers. However, only one mix produced crystals for us. moreover, please note, you can expect growth after 12-15 hours, but the product requires 4-7 days for full growth., Make sure your child is patient. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Hope you don't want all red or all blue crystals.
customer_reviews.text: The crystals mostly turned-out as planned, but they're super-stingy with the seed material to make them blue/red/white. If your kid wants all red crystals for some reason, tough cookies. There's exactly enough seed material to make just enough crystals leaving nothing behind. Most of ours turned-out, with the large white crystal not going so well.
customer_reviews.author: The David C

customer_reviews.title: Check your containers for leaks before mixing.
customer_reviews.text: The largest container had a small hole in it that couldn't be seen. It leaked all over the top of my refrigerator and left a pretty blue stain. Otherwise it was an amusing little time waster and fun to watch the crystals grow. If you do get this kit, fill all containers with water and let sit for a while before doing the mixing. Know if your containers will leak before hand instead of trusting them to get well made, whole containers.
customer_reviews.author: NextDayAir

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions meticulously and out of a whole kit ended up with only two crystals and a disappointed child. Not sure it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Abdalla

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but use caution with small or clumsy children
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a champ and the kids really enjoyed it. Make sure you've got plenty of adult supervision, because there are all sorts of warnings about the danger of direct contact to skin and it gets worse if some idiot kid eats it or rubs it in their eyes. Recommend you dump all the stuff into a the big containers and skip over doing the little tiny ones, cause it becomes too much hassle and the resulting crystals are too small to do anything with.
customer_reviews.author: Heck Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this crystal growing kit as a Christmas gift for our niece. Our crystals grew quickly and much larger than we expected! She had no issues performing the experiment (with adult guidance, of course) and we saved her crystals in small mason jars. The crystals grow just as well as advertised. We kept our crystals on top of the refrigerator, after reading suggestions that a warm environment was best & this may have helped.
customer_reviews.author: Meghaan

customer_reviews.title: So easy! Hot water and patience!
customer_reviews.text: So easy!!! I would say that our crystals didn’t turn out as big as we expected/were lead to believe, so I’m not sure the smaller crystals would be worth it. Thats why I’m at. 4-star. That’s said, this was so easy, all you need is hot water and patience and you can do it. I loved it.
customer_reviews.author: MSanders

customer_reviews.title: Fun experience
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 12YO and she had fun doing this with my mom. It does take a week of sitting in undisturbed area before pouring and creating crystals. Must follow instructions exactly and make sure when you need to stir don't stop until instructed.
customer_reviews.author: Nick and Monique

customer_reviews.title: Fun for any age
customer_reviews.text: Had so much fun. I've been wanting this since I was 10 years old and now I'm almost 30. 20 years later and I finally got it and had so much fun with it. My crystals came out awesome however I think I could've left the large one in longer but I was too impatient. I love how the crystals turned out.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow instructions. Only one batch of crystals grew like crystals. Rest was trash and one stayed liquid. Followed same steps as directions. The one's that grew like crystals we accidentally forgot to put coloring agent in but crystals were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Snugg

customer_reviews.title: Science is cool.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot comment on the longevity of the product, but the wow factor is high with this one. For the price I was hoping for a few more crystals to grow, but this pack has enough that I think everyone will be pleased. I got this for my wife and son to enjoy and do together "for science". The crystals look super cool and grow pretty fast. My son LOVED watching it grow and thinks it looks super cool as a finished object.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know what we did wrong but ours did not turn out at all how they show in the picture on the box. Ours tended to come out in massive clumps. Not really something you would want to display.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old brought home a univirm crystal growing kit from her school book fair, which turned out okay but it was so cheap the thing fell apart from a breeze in her window. I got her this as a replacement and I'm glad i did! It's super easy to do, and they turned out awesome. I wish it had a little more material, since we were only able to make 3 crystals with the products supplied, but she's happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Britt Bess

customer_reviews.title: Waist of money do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this got it as a gift for my son. We followed the instructions to the letter and the result was just crystal dust. No crystal ever grew.
customer_reviews.author: Solange

customer_reviews.title: A very educational and serious project
customer_reviews.text: This one is education. It is not a quick pull it out of the box and watch it happen type toy. Very engaging. I'm thinking it is at level of being a good class project or science project for school. Really impressed. Direction are clear, well written. If you are looking for something to expand your child's learning, this is a good choice. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great science kit
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my nephew for his birthday. He was excited and wanted to use it for learning right away. This is great and when my daughter is older, it will be something I consider as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lyric1985

customer_reviews.title: A fun project! Container hard to assemble, maybe my arthritic hands.
customer_reviews.text: I was Super excited to do this project with my kids. Albeit they were on the younger end of the recommended ages, they still had a good time. The crystals grew great and it was so fun watching them grow! The two things I’m bummed about: is that we got two blue color packets, instead of one red and one blue, so our color choice was limited. But not a big deal. But the containers we are supposed to store them in are so hard to get together that the crystals ended up breaking. Still a great science gift, and i have 2 boys, so they would have broken anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Barrick

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for kids with lots of options for growing your own crystal.
customer_reviews.text: We made the biggest crystal so far and it turned out very well. Our home is a little colder than the directions recommend, so it took a few more days to grow, but we were not disappointed by the results. My son (7) absolutely loves his new crystal! He can't wait to make more. We love that the kit has multiple crystals to make so it's not a "one and done" kit. It also gives you multiple options for colors. The directions are clear and easy to follow. I would definitely recommend this kit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Fun... but my crystals are pretty small. Even the big one only grew maybe an inch and a half. Followed the directions exactly. My 4 year old loved doing it and wat hing them grow everyday, but after 2 weeks of waiting, it's not that impressive.
customer_reviews.author: A Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 yo needed help with this. The steps are more complicated and precise with temperatures and timing , BUT, if you follow the instructions, you do end up with a really cool looking crystal!!! We’ve only made a couple so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear

customer_reviews.title: Niece loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my niece for Christmas and she loves it! Her and her mom are actually working on it now, and is sending me daily pictures so I can see the progress as well. I would highly recommend to any child that has a love for science!
customer_reviews.author: Shana Klutz

customer_reviews.title: Dissatified
customer_reviews.text: Was not satisfied with product. Not for kids due to chemicals used and it did not crystallize well despite following instructions. Was not safe for my son to use on his own so it was not a fun experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Tried two batches. Couldn't grow anything. App gives different instruction than paper direction(wait time after mixing white powder with color crystals). Leaked all over. Kids not happy. Dad not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Triplet Dad Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! My 9-year-old received this for Christmas. The crystals look beautiful and he is very proud. When I wrote the company with a question about toxicity (the crystals are essentially nontoxic if you were wondering) they were quick to reply.
customer_reviews.author: Krystel Rinaman

customer_reviews.title: Really small crystals, not worth it
customer_reviews.text: My outcome doesn’t look anything like the large crystal formations in the packaging. Instead, my crystals turned out small and unimpressive, and I followed the directions exactly. The outcome is disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Vercin

customer_reviews.title: There is some wait time in between steps
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow directions. Semi hard for kids with ADHD to wait in between all the steps but he managed okay. Bought this for my 8 year old, he kept bumping the tray after we were done (it says not to disturb) but they seem to be doing fine. Growing a lot already in less than a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came broken :(
customer_reviews.text: The product is great with good explanations on how to use it. We previously bought one German version that was impossible to figure that out. Unfortunately the big container came completely broken and since this was a present we opened and use it leaving no possibility to return. My son was already disappointed and we didn’t want to make him wait for more time to use it. So we used the smaller containers. I advise to check the package before gift wrapping because there a huge possibility something will be broken inside. My son was little disappointed when his gift was partially shattered. I believe the manufacturer could improve packaging or the container resistance to avoid that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Danieli

customer_reviews.title: This kit does what it says excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: These turned out exactly like the picture! I even grew some of them a little longer and grew HUGE ones! I enjoyed this kit, I bought two, and I would do it again with these kits they make it easy. Quality looking crystals and colorful ones, too. Can mix and make whatever shade you desire. Awesome kit.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great Educational Kit but Arrived Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter after several of her friends also purchased the kit and enjoyed growing the crystals. Unfortunately, one of the crystal growing containers arrived cracked and unusable. Otherwise, this is a great kit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: It's okay...
customer_reviews.text: I love this idea, me and my daughter was excited to do this kit. we followed directions to the T. but for some reason didn't grow big, some didn't fully grow in middle, other didn't grow but all. I'm not sure why I live in Florida and I had this in my kitchen keep the temperature correct. I little disappointed I really wanted nice pretty size crystal. I want to get another one put still iffy if I should.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Came out like pictures on Box!
customer_reviews.text: So I do not usually write reviews for toys. However, my daughter loves the crystal growing kits and we have purchased several different kinds. Most of them do not turn out. This one turned out just like the pictures! She was so excited. (she is 8).
customer_reviews.author: Beth Ann Rice

customer_reviews.title: Good crystals
customer_reviews.text: Good crystals but not sure how to get them all perfect. For the blue Crystal I kept it for a almost a week and a half. It turned out ok. For pinks I kept them for a week over a seeding mat. Only one which had a mix of pink and white colors turned out good. I wasn't happy with the red one though they were placed on the seeding mat too. All in all my experience has been just ok with this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Cover it with a bucket to keep moisture in
customer_reviews.text: They kinda just explode everywhere if you dont keep the thing fully covered. And not like a little capillary action like the instructions said, a lot.... all over my cabinet. They give you a little cardboard ring to put on top and it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan R.

customer_reviews.title: Mostly requires parent doing for safety
customer_reviews.text: Fun kit! Nice looking gift! Instructions are long. Please note adult supervision, but most parts exclusively for adult as there are hazards and it uses boiling water.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting the basic little crumbling crystals. We just finished our first set and wow! It’s been in the provided display case so we haven’t handled it but it’s a solid rock. It does not look like it’s going to crumble by looking at it. We started our second set the same day we finished the first and my son is loving checking on them everyday and watching them grow.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: still waiting.... crystals take forever to form
customer_reviews.text: Cup came with a hole it it... so slowly leaked all over my dining room table, such a mess to clean up. Maybe my daughter did it wrong.. but the crystals are growing up the side of the cup... and out the side of the hole... not really worth the mess
customer_reviews.author: Shanelle

customer_reviews.title: This is the cool science project ever
customer_reviews.text: So cool my 9 year old is going crazy growing crystals . It's so cool to watch the day to day transformations.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not easy with kids and they really need supervision
customer_reviews.text: Don't think you'll get what you see. Needs better instructions. It was exciting at first but if you don't get the mix right it doesn't work and it's not clear how to do that. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Job28:28

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work as stated. The crystals were no more than bread crumbs. I would recommend going to the dollar store and getting a small crystal kit that granted better result (including rocks/ pebbles as bases).
customer_reviews.author: Jojo Coshscure

customer_reviews.title: Not for idiots and inpatient people
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Crystal grow like the box. This is not for idiots, this does not have expiration date. AGAIN THIS IS FOR PEOPLE THAT ACTUALLY HAVE SCIENCE KNOWLEDGE. LIKE HOW TO BOIL WATER AND READ INSTRUCTIONS.
customer_reviews.author: antonio sosa

product_meta.title: 4M 5557 Crystal Growing Science Experimental Kit - Easy DIY Stem Toys Lab Experiment Specimens, A Great Educational Gift for Kids & Teens, Boys & Girls
product_meta.description: Size:GrowingTeach children about the beauty and complexity of crystal growth with the 4M crystal growing experiment. This science kit contains all the materials needed to perform seven different crystal growth experiments. A special display case is included to admire the crystals once they are fully grown. Perfect for young science enthusiasts, especially those with an interest in geology. Complete instructions for each experiment are included with the kit. Recommended for ages 10 years and up.
feature_bullets: This science kit contains all the materials needed to perform seven different crystal growth experiments
A special display case is included to admire the crystals once they are fully grown
Perfect for young science enthusiasts, especially those with an interest in geology
Complete instructions for each experiment are included with the kit
Recommended for ages 10 years and up
Challenge your child's imagination with 4M toys and kits
4M educational toys cover a wide range of educational subjects and include science kits, arts and crafts kits, robotics kits, and more
4M offers a wide range of toys and kits to let you build a clock, crochet a placemat, or turn your room into a planetarium all in the name of making learning fun

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
